intro: Ecbolium rostratum, commonly known as the beakweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the spring. Ecbolium rostratum is a perennial herb that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences.
